member.name: T:DarkRift.DarkRiftReader
member.summary: Helper class for converting byte buffers into their original components during deserialization.

remarks.para: Not thread safe as the read order is critical!
This class implements IDisposable as it is a recyclable object, if you call Dispose the class will be recycled and so it is not compulsory to call Dispose.

member.name: T:DarkRift.DarkRiftWriter
member.summary: Helper class for serializing values into byte buffers.

remarks.para: Not thread safe as the write order is critical!
This class implements IDisposable as it is a recyclable object, if you call Dispose the class will be recycled and so it is not compulsory to call Dispose.

member.summary: The action to execute.

member.summary: Creates an ActionDispatcherTask.

member.name: M:DarkRift.Dispatching.ActionDispatcherTask.Create(System.Action)
member.summary: Creates a new action dispatcher task.

member.summary: Executes the action.

member.name: M:DarkRift.Dispatching.ActionDispatcherTask.ActuallyDispose
member.summary: Actually disposes of the instance rather than recycling it.

member.name: T:DarkRift.Dispatching.Dispatcher
member.summary: Dispatcher for running tasks on the main thread.
member.remarks: The dispatcher is used by DarkRift to move code to the main thread to be executed, either for convienience for programmers that do not know how to use multithreading safely or for use on frameworks where execution across multiple threads is not allowed. Similarly other DarkRift code can also make use of the dispatcher if they require threads to merge execution.

member.name: P:DarkRift.Dispatching.Dispatcher.WaitHandle
member.summary: A wait handle for new dispatcher jobs.
member.remarks: This is released when a new task is assigned to the dispatcher and so can be used to hold the task executing thread idle until a job is posted rather than constantly consuming resources.

member.name: F:DarkRift.Dispatching.Dispatcher.tasks
member.summary: The tasks that need executing.

member.name: F:DarkRift.Dispatching.Dispatcher.jobMutex
member.summary: The mutex for new jobs in the queue.

member.name: F:DarkRift.Dispatching.Dispatcher.executorThreadID
member.summary: The ID of the thread that is executing tasks.

member.name: P:DarkRift.Dispatching.Dispatcher.ExceptionsOnExecutorThread
member.summary: Whether exceptions should be raised on the executor thread.
member.remarks: When set true, any unhandled exceptions that are rasised during the execution of a task will be unsurpressed and thrown on the thread executing the tasks. The exceptions thrown within task executions can still be retreived by accessing the task object.

member.name: P:DarkRift.Dispatching.Dispatcher.Count
member.summary: The number of items waiting to be dispatched.

member.name: M:DarkRift.Dispatching.Dispatcher.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new Dispatcher indicating whether exceptions should be thrown on the executing thread.
member.param: Whether exceptions should be thrown from the executing thread.

member.name: M:DarkRift.Dispatching.Dispatcher.InvokeWait(System.Action)
member.summary: Queues the operation for execution on the main thread and waits until it has completed.
member.remarks: If an exception occurs during the processing of the action the event will be re-thrown by this function for you to handle.
member.exception: Thrown if an unhandled exception was raised while executing the dispatcher task.

member.name: M:DarkRift.Dispatching.Dispatcher.InvokeWait``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Queues the operation for execution on the main thread and waits until it has completed
member.remarks: If an exception occurs during the processing of the function the event will be re-thrown by this function for you to handle.
member.returns: The result of the function executed.
member.exception: Thrown if an unhandled exception was raised while executing the dispatcher task.

member.name: M:DarkRift.Dispatching.Dispatcher.InvokeAsync(System.Action)
member.summary: Queues the operation for execution on the main thread.
member.remarks: This returns an IDisposable object, it is your responsibility to dispose of it when you're done!
member.exception: Thrown if an unhandled exception was raised while executing the dispatcher task when completing synchronously.

member.name: M:DarkRift.Dispatching.Dispatcher.InvokeAsync``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Queues the operation for execution on the main thread.
member.remarks: This returns an IDisposable object, it is your responsibility to dispose of it when you're done!
member.exception: Thrown if an unhandled exception was raised while executing the dispatcher task when completing synchronously.

member.name: M:DarkRift.Dispatching.Dispatcher.ExecuteDispatcherTasks
member.summary: Executes all tasks queued for execution.
member.exception: Thrown if an unhandled exception was raised while executing a dispatcher task.

member.name: M:DarkRift.Dispatching.Dispatcher.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of the dispatcher object.

member.name: T:DarkRift.Dispatching.DispatcherException
member.summary: A wrapper for unhandled exceptions thrown within dispatcher tasks so the stacktrace is preserved.

member.name: M:DarkRift.Dispatching.DispatcherException.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new exception with no parameters.

member.name: M:DarkRift.Dispatching.DispatcherException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new exception with a message.

member.name: M:DarkRift.Dispatching.DispatcherException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Creates a new exception with a message and inner exceptions.
member.param: The exception raised in the task.

member.name: T:DarkRift.Dispatching.DispatcherTask
member.summary: Base class for all tasks on the dispatcher.
member.remarks: Note that DispatcherTask is marked so must be disposed of accordingly after use.

member.name: P:DarkRift.Dispatching.DispatcherTask.WaitHandle
member.summary: The wait handle that will be set when the operation completes.
member.remarks: This can be used to pause another thread's execution until the task has completed on the main dispatcher's execution thread.

member.name: F:DarkRift.Dispatching.DispatcherTask.manualResetEvent
member.summary: The ManualResetEvent that will be set once executed.

member.summary: The state of this dispatcher task.

member.name: P:DarkRift.Dispatching.DispatcherTask.Exception
member.summary: The exception that occured while the event was being processed.

member.summary: Executes the task.

member.summary: Sets the wait handle for this task and updates the TaskState to completed.

member.summary: Sets the wait handle for this task and updates the task state to failed.
member.param: The exception that cause the failure (if present).

member.summary: Dispose of this connection.

member.summary: Dispose of this connection.

member.name: T:DarkRift.Dispatching.DispatcherTaskState
member.summary: The possible states that a can be in.

member.name: F:DarkRift.Dispatching.DispatcherTaskState.Queued
member.summary: The task is queued for execution in the dispatcher but not yet run.

member.name: F:DarkRift.Dispatching.DispatcherTaskState.CompletedQueued
member.summary: The task was queued and has been completed.

member.name: F:DarkRift.Dispatching.DispatcherTaskState.CompletedImmediate
member.summary: The task was completed without being queued (i.e. you were already on the execution thread)

member.name: F:DarkRift.Dispatching.DispatcherTaskState.Failed
member.summary: The task was run but threw an exception.

member.summary: The quietest log level. Indicates the information is not of immediate importance but it worth note.

member.summary: Indicates the information is of general use.

member.summary: Indicates the information is warning the user.

member.summary: Indicates the information is the result of an error.

member.name: T:DarkRift.Message
member.summary: Message class for all messages sent through DarkRift.
member.remarks: Since each message is handled by single, separate threads this class is not thread safe.

member.name: F:DarkRift.Message.COMMAND_FLAG_MASK
member.summary: Bitmask for the command message flag.

member.name: F:DarkRift.Message.buffer
member.summary: The data buffer received.
member.remarks: WARNING! Modifying the data in this buffer will alter the data of all clones of this message! Only ever change the reference!

member.name: F:DarkRift.Message.dataOffset
member.summary: The offset of data in the buffer.

member.summary: The flags attached to this message.

member.name: T:DarkRift.ObjectCache
member.summary: A cache of DarkRift objects for recycling.
member.remarks: Must be initialized on the thread using DarkRiftServer.InitializeObjectCache() or will throw errors.

member.name: F:DarkRift.ObjectCache.initialized
member.summary: Whether this cache has been initialized yet.

member.name: F:DarkRift.ObjectCache.writerPool
member.summary: Object pool of DarkRiftWriters.

member.name: F:DarkRift.ObjectCache.readerPool
member.summary: Object pool of DarkRiftReaders.

member.name: F:DarkRift.ObjectCache.messagePool
member.summary: Object pool of Messages.

member.name: F:DarkRift.ObjectCache.socketAsyncEventArgsPool
member.summary: Object pool of SocketAsyncEventArgs.

member.name: F:DarkRift.ObjectCache.actionDispatcherTaskPool
member.summary: Object pool of ActionDispatcherTasks.

member.name: F:DarkRift.ObjectCache.settings
member.summary: The settings for all object caches.

member.name: F:DarkRift.ObjectCache.settingsLock
member.summary: The lock for the settings field.

member.name: M:DarkRift.ObjectCache.Initialize(DarkRift.ObjectCacheSettings)
member.summary: Sets up the ObjectCache with the given settings.
member.returns: True if the object cache was set with the sepcified settings, false if it is already initialized.

member.name: M:DarkRift.ObjectCache.ThreadInitialize
member.summary: Initializes the object cache with the stored settings.

member.name: M:DarkRift.ObjectCache.GetWriter
member.summary: Returns a pooled DarkRiftWriter or generates a new one if there are none available.

member.name: M:DarkRift.ObjectCache.ReturnWriter(DarkRift.DarkRiftWriter)
member.summary: Returns a used DarkRiftWriter to the pool.

member.name: M:DarkRift.ObjectCache.GetReader
member.summary: Returns a pooled DarkRiftReader or generates a new one if there are none available.

member.name: M:DarkRift.ObjectCache.ReturnReader(DarkRift.DarkRiftReader)
member.summary: Returns a used DarkRiftReader to the pool.

member.name: M:DarkRift.ObjectCache.GetMessage
member.summary: Returns a pooled Message or generates a new one if there are none available.

member.name: M:DarkRift.ObjectCache.ReturnMessage(DarkRift.Message)
member.summary: Returns a used Message to the pool.

member.name: M:DarkRift.ObjectCache.GetSocketAsyncEventArgs
member.summary: Returns a pooled SocketAsyncEventArgs object or generates a new one if there are none available.

member.name: M:DarkRift.ObjectCache.ReturnSocketAsyncEventArgs(System.Net.Sockets.SocketAsyncEventArgs)
member.summary: Returns a used SocketAsyncEventArgs object to the pool or disposes of it if there are already enough.

member.name: M:DarkRift.ObjectCache.GetActionDispatcherTask
member.summary: Returns a pooled ActionDispatcherTask or generates a new one if there are none available.

member.name: M:DarkRift.ObjectCache.ReturnActionDispatcherTask(DarkRift.Dispatching.ActionDispatcherTask)
member.summary: Returns a used ActionDispatcherTask to the pool.

member.name: T:DarkRift.ObjectPool`1
member.summary: Generic pool of objects for implementing recycling.
member.remarks: This object is not thread safe as it is intended to be used with the ThreadStatic attribute.

member.name: P:DarkRift.ObjectPool`1.MaxObjects
member.summary: The maximum number of objects allowed in this pool per thread.

member.name: P:DarkRift.ObjectPool`1.Count
member.summary: The number of objects currently pooled in this thread's pool.

member.name: F:DarkRift.ObjectPool`1.generate
member.summary: The function to generate a new isntance of T.

member.name: F:DarkRift.ObjectPool`1.pool
member.summary: The pool of pooled objects.

member.name: M:DarkRift.ObjectPool`1.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Func{`0})
member.summary: Creates a new object pool.
member.param: The maximum number of elements to store per thread.
The function that will be invoked to generate a new instance. This must be thread safe.

member.name: M:DarkRift.ObjectPool`1.GetInstance
member.summary: Provides an instance of the class.

member.name: M:DarkRift.ObjectPool`1.ReturnInstance(`0)
member.summary: Returns an instance of the class to the pool.
member.returns: Whether the instance was returned true or should be disposed of false.

member.name: T:DarkRift.SendMode
member.summary: The send mode to govern how messages are sent.

member.name: F:DarkRift.SendMode.Unreliable
member.summary: Sends the message unreliably.
member.remarks: This will not fragment large messages, use Reliable if this is needed.

member.name: F:DarkRift.SendMode.Reliable
member.summary: Sends the message and ensures it will arive at it's destination.
member.remarks: THis will also fragment large messages unlike Unreliable.

member.name: T:DarkRift.SerializeEvent
member.summary: DEscribes the serialization in progress.

member.name: P:DarkRift.SerializeEvent.Writer
member.summary: The writer to write the object data to.
